qas.question: What should be anticipated because of the many factors that influence wood's density?
What specific type of growth has an effect on the density of wood?
Which part of a tree can have vertical or horizontal variation in its specific gravity?
Variation in what measurement is sometimes greater within one tree than from one tree to another?
What tiny object's source plays a role in determining wood density?

context: Age, diameter, height, <a1_0>radial<a1_0/> growth, geographical location, site and growing conditions, silvicultural treatment, and <a4_0>seed<a4_0/> source, all to some degree influence wood density. <a0_0>Variation<a0_0/> is to be expected. Within an individual tree, the variation in wood <a3_0>density<a3_0/> is often as great as or even greater than that between different trees (Timell 1986). Variation of specific gravity within the <a2_0>bole<a2_0/> of a tree can occur in either the horizontal or vertical direction. :)
